file_content.text: It's still here. Still waiting for us....
Admiral! Intruder!
Target her, but do not fire.
Target him, but do not fire.
The Hand of Jadus lives. I wondered what became of you.
The Cipher agent lives. I wondered what became of you.
I know about your hoard and your deal with the pirates. You betrayed the Empire.
It's over, Admiral.
You say that so easily.
You've caused a lot of trouble for a man I didn't come here to kill.
All of this wasn't necessary.
What do we have here? Blasters, armor, kolto, credits... Sith relics?
This must be your treasure...
The ships downed in the battle carried many valuables. I did not discriminate.
I waited years to return to Hoth and reclaim my... retirement funds. My superiors were never to know.
We should take her now.
We should take him now.
Silence.
You complicated matters; forced us to part ways with the Empire. But this can be mended--tell me what you desire.
No bribes, Admiral. All I want is your surrender.
You need to turn yourself in.
You want to avoid being branded a traitor. I want to know about that Republic shuttle.
Let's discuss the Starbreeze.
Ah. The Starbreeze. I recall your interest.
The shuttle? How interesting.
It was the personal ship of one Colonel Omas. He served in the upper echelons of Republic weapons research.
Rumor was that the Starbreeze contained his records and security codes. I brought it here for safekeeping. Does that pique your interest?
Are you willing to give it up?
I need that ship.
What sort of weapons research did he do?
You said "weapons research"...
Omas prototyped space stations, ion cannons... he died aboard this very dreadnaught--another of his many projects.
You sound pathetic. Is that all you have?
You're getting desperate.
The shuttle is yours. I ask only two things: your silence... and the location of the secret Chiss base.
But the shuttle is ours! Our payment!
It is a small price to remove the Chiss from the equation. They know too much.
Sir, even if we wipe them out, we can't trust....
We are all Imperials! Give me the Chiss, pledge your silence and we will all return to the Empire in glory. You will have your shuttle, and wealth besides.
You're not killing the Chiss, and I won't take your bribe.
No deal.
Captain Furth and the pirates seem troubled--but loyalties change, I suppose.
Your people don't seem happy..
Captain Furth has been with me for ten years. As for the pirates, they will accommodate us.
We will not be cut out of this deal!
I make the choices here. Now, agent--decide.
I won't join you.
A woman of principles. How admirable. Kill her.
A man of principles. How admirable. Kill him.
Listen to them, Admiral. They're taking advantage of you.
Your men will betray you.
I saw Captain Furth's meeting with the pirates. He's planning to join them and take the hoard for himself.
Perhaps....
You're lying!
Enough of this. We have the treasure. Kill them all.
The Chiss operate out of Zero Station. These are the coordinates.
All right--let's team up.
These are the coordinates of Zero Station. The Chiss are based there.
You can have the Chiss.
Very good. They will be eliminated within the hour, and their base will be my gift to the Marauders.
Huh. It will do.
It has been a pleasure, agent. Perhaps we will work together again, some day.
Get this stuff loaded and moved through the rear entrance. We should leave before our hosts grow impatient.
I'm not negotiating. [Attack]
Packed and ready, Admiral. Unless you're worried about the captain's flare?
No. We cannot wait.
Packed and ready, Admiral. Waiting on your word.
Excellent. Then the time has come.
Intruder alert!
Is this how they're supposed to react?
Imagine if we hadn't gone through proper channels.
They are a bit on edge, don't you think?
Officer. I am Admiral Davos, commander of this expedition. You were not invited.
Officer. I am Admiral Davos, commander of this expedition. You were not expected.
I have full authorization to be here. Is there a problem?
You treat your guests poorly.
Cipher Nine. Imperial Intelligence.
Good to meet you.
An Intelligence agent... of course.
Tell your men to stand down, or I can't be responsible for their fate.
Back off!
As you wish.
You must excuse our caution. Hoth is not a world that forgives mistakes--a lesson that scarred me long ago.
Weapons down, everyone.
We are in the midst of a delicate operation. These men are preparing to follow me to the starship graveyard.
The Minister of Intelligence says I'm to assist your men and insure the interests of the Empire.
I mean to join them.
By order of Lord Jadus, I am to join your expedition and insure the interests of the Empire.
I mean to join them.
I see. Months ago, I could have accommodated this.
I came for help, Admiral. Have you heard of a Republic shuttle called the Starbreeze?
This is about a ship....
The colonel's vessel. Indeed. What is your interest in it?
You're going after it. What do you know?
You tell me.
I need to know everything. Who's the colonel? What makes the ship special?
Who's the colonel?
Enough to make a man wealthy for a lifetime. A pity you did not come to me earlier.
Nothing. I only wanted to ask.
The SIS wants it back.
You can't betray them so easily.
If I had known about you beforehand, perhaps... alas, now it is too late.
I'm not a fool, Admiral--this isn't an ordinary mission. You're holding back, your people are paranoid....
I want in on your scheme.
... but deal me in, and we won't have an issue.
True, my mission is not what the record states. A pity you did not come to me months ago.
Now, I'm afraid we approach the crisis point, and I cannot afford additional risk.
Commander? Torture her and find out what she knows. Then kill her.
Commander? Torture him and find out what he knows. Then kill him.
